tool.name: FileConverter
tool.description: Converts between different MS file formats
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && ln -s '$in' 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' && mkdir out &&
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' -out 'out/output.${out_type}'
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${out_type}' '$out' #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.label: Output file type -- default: determined from file extension or content
param.help: Note: that not all conversion paths work or make sense

param.label: unique ID post-processing for output data
param.help: 'none' keeps current IDs even if invalid.. 'ensure' keeps current IDs but reassigns invalid ones.. 'reassign' assigns new unique IDs

param.label: Export the TIC instead of the entire experiment in mzML/mzData/mzXML -> DTA2D conversions
Use a more compact format when writing MGF (no zero-intensity peaks, limited number of decimal places)
[mzXML output only] Make sure that MaxQuant can read the mzXML and set the msManufacturer to 'Thermo Scientific'
[mzML output only] Make sure that TPP parsers can read the mzML and the precursor ion m/z in the file (otherwise it will be set to zero by the TPP)
[mzML output only] Assumes that the provided spectra represent data in SRM mode or targeted MS1 mode and converts them to chromatogram data

[mzML output only] How to store ion mobility scans (none: no change in format; multiple_spectra: store each IM frame as multiple scans (one per drift time value); concatenated: store whole frame as single scan with IM values in a FloatDataArray
Append an index when writing mzML or mzXML files
param.help: Some external tools might rely on it

param.label: Use numpress compression to achieve optimally small file size using linear compression for m/z domain and slof for intensity and float data arrays (attention: may cause small loss of precision; only for mzML data)
Desired (absolute) m/z accuracy for lossy compression
param.help: (e.g. use 0.0001 for a mass accuracy of 0.2 ppm at 500 m/z, default uses -1.0 for maximal accuracy)

param.label: Whether to process the file on the fly without loading the whole file into memory first (only for conversions of mzXML/mzML to mzML)
param.help: Note: this flag will prevent conversion from spectra to chromatograms

param.label: Disables vendor peak picking for raw files
Disables zlib compression for raw file conversion
param.help: Enables compatibility with some tools that do not support compressed input files, e.g. X!Tandem

param.label: Include noise data in mzML output
Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

data.name: ctd_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: ctd
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "ctd_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

tool.help:
Converts between different MS file formats.
For more information, visit https://openms.de/doxygen/release/3.1.0/html/TOPP_FileConverter.html
